metadata.description: Curated Church Fathers quotes organized by Scripture reference and theme

era_guide.ante_nicene: 100-325 AD (Justin Martyr, Irenaeus, Tertullian, Origen, Cyprian)
era_guide.nicene: 325-451 AD (Athanasius, Basil, Gregory, Chrysostom, Augustine, Jerome, Cyril)
era_guide.post_nicene: 451-750 AD (Gregory the Great, John of Damascus)

Genesis 1:1.author: Augustine
Genesis 1:1.quote: In the beginning God made heaven and earth. How, O God, didst Thou make heaven and earth? Truly, neither in heaven nor in earth didst Thou make heaven and earth.
Genesis 1:1.context: Augustine meditates on creation from nothing

Genesis 1:1.author: Basil the Great
Genesis 1:1.quote: 'In the beginning God created.' It is to teach us that at the will of God the world arose in less than an instant.
Genesis 1:1.context: Commentary on the six days of creation

Genesis 3:15.author: Irenaeus
Genesis 3:15.quote: He has therefore summed up all things in Himself, both waging war against our enemy and crushing him who at the beginning had led us captive in Adam.

Genesis 3:15.author: Justin Martyr
Genesis 3:15.quote: Christ became man by the Virgin, in order that the disobedience which proceeded from the serpent might receive its destruction in the same manner in which it derived its origin.
Genesis 3:15.context: Christ as the seed of the woman

Psalm 22:1.author: Augustine
Psalm 22:1.quote: Our Lord Jesus Christ spoke these words on the Cross. They are His words, and yet not His, for He was speaking in our name.
Psalm 22:1.context: Christ prays the Psalms from the cross

Psalm 23:1.author: Gregory of Nyssa
Psalm 23:1.work: On the Inscriptions of the Psalms
Psalm 23:1.quote: He who has made the Good Shepherd his own will not want any good thing. For the Lord himself is what he wants.

Psalm 23:1.author: Augustine
Psalm 23:1.quote: The Lord rules me, and nothing shall be wanting to me. Who can say this? The humble, the poor.

Isaiah 7:14.author: Justin Martyr
Isaiah 7:14.quote: The prophecy foretold that He would be born of a virgin. Behold, a virgin shall conceive and bear a son.

Isaiah 7:14.author: Irenaeus
Isaiah 7:14.quote: The Lord Himself gave us a sign, in the depth and in the height, which man did not ask for, because he never expected that a virgin could conceive.
Isaiah 7:14.context: The miraculous nature of the incarnation

Isaiah 53:5.author: Clement of Rome
Isaiah 53:5.quote: He was wounded for our transgressions, and bruised for our iniquities. By His stripes we are healed.

Isaiah 53:5.author: Origen
Isaiah 53:5.quote: The prophecy clearly speaks of one who would suffer for the sins of others, and by whose wounds healing would come to all.

Matthew 5:3.author: Chrysostom
Matthew 5:3.quote: What is being poor in spirit? Being humble and contrite in mind. For by 'spirit' He meant the soul and the temper of mind.

Matthew 5:3.author: Augustine
Matthew 5:3.quote: Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven. The poor in spirit are rightly understood as the humble.

Matthew 16:18.author: Chrysostom
Matthew 16:18.quote: Upon this rock, that is, upon the faith of his confession. Thereby signifying that many throughout the world were to believe.
Matthew 16:18.context: Peter's confession and the Church's foundation

Matthew 16:18.author: Augustine
Matthew 16:18.quote: I said that the Church is built upon Peter, as upon a rock, but this rock was Christ, whom Simon confessed.

Matthew 16:18.author: Cyprian
Matthew 16:18.work: On the Unity of the Church
Matthew 16:18.quote: Upon one He builds the Church, and to him He gives the command to feed the sheep.

John 1:1.author: Origen
John 1:1.quote: In the beginning was the Word. We must understand that Jesus is more things than one. He is the Light of the world, the Way, the Truth, and the Life.

John 1:1.author: Augustine
John 1:1.quote: In the beginning was the Word. He was, He was not made; for if made, He was not; and if He was, He was not made.
John 1:1.context: The eternal existence of the Word

John 1:14.author: Athanasius
John 1:14.quote: The Word became flesh to make us partakers of the divine nature. He became what we are that He might make us what He is.

John 1:14.author: Cyril of Alexandria
John 1:14.quote: The Word became flesh, not by changing into flesh, but by assuming flesh while remaining what He was.

John 3:16.author: Augustine
John 3:16.quote: God loves each of us as if there were only one of us to love.
John 3:16.context: The personal nature of divine love

John 3:16.author: Chrysostom
John 3:16.quote: See the Father's love! He gave not a servant, not an angel, but His own Son. His only-begotten.

John 6:53-56.author: Ignatius of Antioch
John 6:53-56.quote: They abstain from the Eucharist, because they do not confess that the Eucharist is the flesh of our Savior Jesus Christ.

John 6:53-56.author: Cyril of Jerusalem
John 6:53-56.quote: He has declared this is My Body. Who shall dare to doubt hereafter? He has assured us this is My Blood. Who shall ever hesitate?

John 6:53-56.author: Augustine
John 6:53-56.quote: O sacrament of devotion! O sign of unity! O bond of charity! He who would live has where to live, has what to live by.
John 6:53-56.context: The Eucharist as source of life

John 14:6.author: Augustine
John 14:6.quote: Christ is the way, walk by Him. Christ is the truth, be established by Him. Christ is the life, live in Him.
John 14:6.context: Christ as the exclusive path to the Father

John 14:6.author: Cyril of Alexandria
John 14:6.quote: He is the Way because He leads us to the Father. He is the Truth because He is not a type but reality itself. He is the Life because He conquered death.

Romans 5:12.author: Augustine
Romans 5:12.quote: Through one man sin entered into the world, and death through sin, and so death passed to all men, in whom all sinned.

Romans 5:12.author: Irenaeus
Romans 5:12.quote: As by the disobedience of one man sin entered, and death by sin, so also by the obedience of one man righteousness was introduced.

Romans 8:28.author: Augustine
Romans 8:28.quote: God would never allow any evil to exist in His works unless His omnipotence and goodness were such as to bring good even out of evil.

Romans 8:28.author: Chrysostom
Romans 8:28.quote: Not things only, but even what seem to be distressing, these work together for good to those who love God.

1 Corinthians 11:24-25.author: Justin Martyr
1 Corinthians 11:24-25.quote: This food we call Eucharist, of which no one is allowed to partake except one who believes our teachings to be true and has received the washing for forgiveness of sins.

1 Corinthians 11:24-25.author: Irenaeus
1 Corinthians 11:24-25.quote: When the mingled cup and the manufactured bread receive the Word of God, the Eucharist becomes the body and blood of Christ.

Ephesians 5:25-27.author: Augustine
Ephesians 5:25-27.quote: Christ loved the Church and gave Himself for her, that He might make her glorious, without spot or wrinkle.
Ephesians 5:25-27.context: Christ and the Church as Bridegroom and Bride

Ephesians 5:25-27.author: Chrysostom
Ephesians 5:25-27.quote: Would you have your wife obedient to you, as the Church is to Christ? Take the same care for her as Christ takes for the Church.

Philippians 2:6-8.author: Athanasius
Philippians 2:6-8.quote: He became man that we might become divine. He revealed Himself through a body that we might receive knowledge of the invisible Father.

Philippians 2:6-8.author: Hilary of Poitiers
Philippians 2:6-8.quote: He emptied Himself, taking the form of a servant, not losing what He was but assuming what He was not.
Philippians 2:6-8.context: The incarnation without loss of divinity

Hebrews 4:12.author: Origen
Hebrews 4:12.quote: The word of God is living and active, sharper than any two-edged sword. It enters into the depths of our soul.

1 Peter 3:21.author: Cyprian
1 Peter 3:21.quote: As the ark of Noah saved through water, so baptism now saves us, not as a removal of dirt but as a pledge of a good conscience.

1 Peter 3:21.author: Augustine
1 Peter 3:21.quote: The ark signifies the Church, which is saved through the wood of Christ's cross, floating above the waters of this world.
1 Peter 3:21.context: The Church as ark of salvation

Revelation 21:1-4.author: Augustine
Revelation 21:1-4.quote: There shall be a new heaven and a new earth. The first heaven and the first earth shall pass away, and the Church, the bride, shall appear in glory.

Revelation 21:1-4.author: Irenaeus
Revelation 21:1-4.quote: God shall wipe away every tear, and death shall be no more. This is the promise reserved for those who persevere.

trinity.author: Athanasius
trinity.quote: The Father is made known by the Son, and in the Spirit. They are one in essence, three in persons.

trinity.author: Gregory of Nazianzus
trinity.quote: I cannot think of the One without being encircled by the splendor of the Three; nor can I discern the Three without being led back to the One.

trinity.author: Augustine
trinity.quote: The Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, as they are one God, so also are one substance. And therefore it is not three gods, but one God.

salvation.author: Clement of Rome
salvation.quote: We are not justified by ourselves, nor by our wisdom or understanding or piety, but by faith, through which almighty God has justified all who have existed from the beginning.

salvation.author: Augustine
salvation.quote: You have made us for yourself, O Lord, and our heart is restless until it rests in you.

church.author: Cyprian
church.work: On the Unity of the Church
church.quote: He cannot have God for his father who does not have the Church for his mother.

church.author: Ignatius of Antioch
church.quote: Wherever the bishop appears, let the people be there; just as wherever Jesus Christ is, there is the Catholic Church.

suffering.author: Augustine
suffering.quote: In my deepest wound I saw your glory, and it dazzled me.

suffering.author: Chrysostom
suffering.quote: Affliction is able to produce glory, and glory that is eternal. Therefore do not faint in tribulations.

prayer.author: Augustine
prayer.quote: Pray as though everything depended on God. Work as though everything depended on you.

prayer.author: Evagrius Ponticus
prayer.quote: Prayer is the raising of the mind and heart to God.

love.author: Augustine
love.quote: Love, and do what you will. If you keep silence, keep silence by love; if you speak, speak by love; if you correct, correct by love; if you pardon, pardon by love.

love.author: Maximus the Confessor
love.quote: Love is the goal of all virtues; it contains them all within itself.

augustine.name: Augustine of Hippo
augustine.significance: Bishop of Hippo, Doctor of the Church, foundational Western theologian

chrysostom.name: John Chrysostom
chrysostom.significance: Archbishop of Constantinople, greatest preacher of the early church

irenaeus.name: Irenaeus of Lyon
irenaeus.significance: Student of Polycarp (who knew John), key anti-Gnostic writer

origen.name: Origen of Alexandria
origen.significance: Greatest biblical scholar of early church, pioneered allegory

athanasius.name: Athanasius of Alexandria
athanasius.significance: Defender of Nicene orthodoxy against Arianism

jerome.name: Jerome
jerome.significance: Translator of the Vulgate, biblical scholar

cyprian.name: Cyprian of Carthage
major_works: On the Unity of the Church

ignatius.name: Ignatius of Antioch
ignatius.significance: Third bishop of Antioch, martyr, earliest witness to church structure
